verses.verse: You shall not see<WH7200> your brother<WH251>'s ox<WH7794> or his sheep<WH7716> go astray<WH5080>, and hide<WH5956> yourself from them<WH7725>: you shall in any case bring them again<WH7725> unto your brother<WH251>.

And if your brother<WH251> be not near<WH7138> unto you<WH3045>, or if you know him not<WH622>, then you shall bring it unto<WH8432> your own house<WH1004>, and it shall be with you until your brother<WH251> seek<WH1875> after it<WH7725>, and you shall restore it to him again.

In like manner<WH3651> shall you do<WH6213> with his donkey<WH2543>; and so shall you do<WH6213> with his clothes<WH8071>; and with all lost thing<WH9> of your brother<WH251>'s, which he has lost<WH6>, and you have found<WH4672>, shall you do<WH6213> likewise<WH3201>: you may not hide yourself<WH5956>.

You shall not see<WH7200> your brother<WH251>'s donkey<WH2543> or his ox<WH7794> fall down<WH5307> by the way<WH1870>, and hide<WH5956> yourself from them<WH6965>: you shall surely help him to lift them up again<WH6965>.

The woman<WH802> shall not wear that which pertains<WH3627> unto a man<WH1397>, neither shall a man<WH1397> put<WH3847> on a woman<WH802>'s garment<WH8071>: for all that do<WH6213> so<WH428> are abomination<WH8441> unto the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>.

If a bird<WH6833>'s nest<WH7064> chance<WH7122> to be before<WH6440> you in the way<WH1870> in any tree<WH6086>, or on the ground<WH776>, whether they be young ones<WH667>, or eggs<WH1000>, and the mother<WH517> sitting<WH7257> upon the young<WH667>, or upon the eggs<WH1000>, you shall not take<WH3947> the mother<WH517> with the young<WH1121>:
But you shall in any wise<WH7971> let the mother<WH517> go<WH7971>, and take<WH3947> the young<WH1121> to you<WH3190>; that it may be well with you<WH748>, and that you may prolong your days<WH3117>.

When you build<WH1129> a new<WH2319> house<WH1004>, then you shall make<WH6213> a battlement<WH4624> for your roof<WH1406>, that you bring<WH7760> not blood<WH1818> upon your house<WH1004>, if any man<WH5307> fall from there<WH5307>.

You shall not sow<WH2232> your vineyard<WH3754> with various seeds<WH3610>: lest the fruit<WH4395> of your seed<WH2233> which you have sown<WH2232>, and the fruit<WH8393> of your vineyard<WH3754>, be defiled<WH6942>.
You shall not plow<WH2790> with an ox<WH7794> and an donkey<WH2543> together<WH3162>.
You shall not wear<WH3847> a garment of various sorts<WH8162>, as of wool<WH6785> and linen<WH6593> together<WH3162>.
You shall make<WH6213> you fringes<WH1434> upon the four<WH702> quarters<WH3671> of your vesture<WH3682>, with which you cover yourself<WH3680>.
If any man<WH376> take<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and go in<WH935> unto her<WH8130>, and hate her,

And give<WH7760> occasions<WH5949> of speech<WH1697> against her<WH3318>, and bring up an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon her<WH559>, and say, I took<WH3947> this woman<WH802>, and when I came<WH7126> to her<WH4672>, I found her not a maid<WH1331>:

Then shall the father<WH1> of the girl<WH5291>, and her mother<WH517>, take<WH3947> and bring forth<WH3318> the tokens of the damsel<WH5291>'s virginity<WH1331> unto the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892> in the gate<WH8179>:
And the damsel<WH5291>'s father<WH1> shall say<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205>, I gave<WH5414> my daughter<WH1323> unto this man<WH376> to wife<WH802>, and he hates her<WH8130>;

And<WH7760>, behold, he has given occasions<WH5949> of speech<WH1697> against her<WH559>, saying, I found<WH4672> not your daughter<WH1323> a maid<WH1331>; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter<WH1323>'s virginity<WH1331>. And they shall spread<WH6566> the cloth<WH8071> before<WH6440> the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892>.
And the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892> shall take<WH3947> that man<WH376> and chastise him<WH3256>;

And they shall fine<WH6064> him in an hundred<WH3967> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and give<WH5414> them unto the father<WH1> of the girl<WH5291>, because he has brought up<WH3318> an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon a virgin<WH1330> of Israel<WH3478>: and she shall be his wife<WH802>; he may<WH3201> not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
But if this thing<WH1697> be true<WH571>, and the tokens of virginity<WH1331> be not found<WH4672> for the girl<WH5291>:

Then they shall bring out<WH3318> the girl<WH5291> to the door<WH6607> of her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>, and the men<WH582> of her city<WH5892> shall stone<WH5619> her with stones<WH68> that she die<WH4191>: because she has worked<WH6213> wickedness<WH5039> in Israel<WH3478>, to play the whore<WH2181> in her father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>: so shall you put<WH1197> evil<WH7451> away<WH1197> from among you<WH7130>.

If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> lying<WH7901> with a woman<WH802> married<WH1166> to an husband<WH1167>, then they shall both of them<WH8147> die<WH4191>, both the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with the woman<WH802>, and the woman<WH802>: so shall you put away<WH1197> evil<WH7451> from Israel<WH3478>.
If a girl<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330> be married<WH781> unto an husband<WH376>, and a man<WH376> find<WH4672> her in the city<WH5892>, and lie with her<WH7901>;

Then you shall bring<WH3318> them both<WH8147> out unto the gate<WH8179> of that city<WH5892>, and you shall stone<WH5619> them with stones<WH68> that they die<WH4191>; the girl<WH5291>, because<WH834> she cried<WH6817> not<WH5892>, being in the city; and the man<WH376>, because<WH834> he has humbled<WH6031> his neighbour<WH7453>'s wife<WH802>: so you shall put away<WH1197> evil<WH7451> from among you<WH7130>.

But if a man<WH376> find<WH4672> a married<WH781> girl<WH5291> in the field<WH7704>, and the man<WH376> force<WH2388> her<WH7901>, and lie with her<WH376>: then the man only that lay<WH7901> with her shall die<WH4191>:

But unto the girl<WH5291> you shall do<WH6213> nothing<WH1697>; there is in the girl<WH5291> no sin<WH2399> worthy of death<WH4194>: for as when a man<WH376> rises<WH6965> against his neighbor<WH7453>, and slays<WH7523> him<WH1697>, even so is this matter:
For he found<WH4672> her in the field<WH7704>, and the married<WH781> girl<WH5291> cried<WH6817>, and there was none to save her<WH3467>.
If a man<WH376> find<WH4672> a girl<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330>, which is not married<WH781>, and lay hold<WH8610> on her<WH7901>, and lie with her<WH4672>, and they be found;

Then the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with her shall give<WH5414> unto the damsel<WH5291>'s father<WH1> fifty<WH2572> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and she shall be his wife<WH802>; because he has humbled<WH6031> her<WH3201>, he may not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
A man<WH376> shall not take<WH3947> his father<WH1>'s wife<WH802>, nor uncover<WH1540> his father<WH1>'s skirt<WH3671>.
